title: You can now buy a four floor flat in a castle in London - and it's just stunning
text:

Many holidaymakers will have visited castles this summer, but what about owning one, or living or working in one?

Well, you can now do exactly that - and in the heart of London too.

A new property that's just been listed on Zoopla is offering a wealthy individual - or family - the chance to own their own flat in a castle, and it looks dreamy.

The apartment, nestled in Greenwich, home to the Cutty Sark, is situated over four floors - and comes with four rooms, too.

It includes a grand reception room with dining space and generously sized kitchen - and is set within 2.5 acres of communal gardens.

(Image: zoopla.co.uk)

(Image: zoopla.co.uk)

(Image: zoopla.co.uk)

Even better, it comes complete with its own roof terrace with stunning views over London, overlooking pergolas and skyscrapers.

But it won't come cheap, with an eye-watering asking price of £2.5million.

The property, which has amassed 371 views in just 30 days on Zoopla, comes with two private, dedicated parking spaces - perfect for a family home.

And it's rich in history too - being inside a Grade I listed castle with many period features.

This property is located on Maze Hill, overlooking the beautiful green space of Greenwich Park and is within easy reach of the shops and restaurants of Central Greenwich.

Fancy putting an offer in? Check it out on Zoopla here.

(Image: zoopla.co.uk)

(Image: zoopla.co.uk)

(Image: zoopla.co.uk)

Or, if it's not quite right for you, how about this fancy London chalet - that even includes its own private beach, instead?

In our hot property series, we took a look at Justin Bieber's Northern pad last week, where he stayed while on tour in Manchester.

The two-acre property, which even has its own helicopter pad, is known as 'Helsby Hill' and is nestled in the countryside near the city of Chester.

And despite being reduced by £800,000, the mansion, complete with its indoor pool and football pitch, will still set you back £3.95million.

But on the plus side, that includes its indoor heated pool, a jacuzzi you can watch TV from, a sauna and steam room, gym area, five bathrooms and private living quarters for staff.
description: Forget Sandringham Estate, this four bedroom Grade I listed castle offers spacious accommodation with many period features
